reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative:
Provision of multi-sectoral interventions in WASH, Dignified shelter, Food Security, and Education for the most vulnerable groups in Northwest Syria
Envelope 1

description.narrative:
The project will respond to identified needs in the SNFI, WASH, FSL, and Edu Clusters, with the primary intervention assisting IDPs living in tented informal settlements in flood-prone areas, with a high lack of privacy, protection, and dignity. A series of comprehensive and integrated operations will be carried out in coordination with the aforementioned clusters, where these integrated interventions will aim to improve the dignity of IDPs and provide privacy and decrease GBV risks for women and girls. The project will target 12 prioritized locations in both Aleppo and Idleb with a total of 1361 beneficiaries (Men 369 - Women 427 – Boys 292 – Girls 273) The interventions will be as follow:
Shelter: Installation of dignified shelter units for the protracted IDPs with rehabilitation to upgrade the living environment for the most vulnerable, in Al-Omran camp in Maaret Tamsrin, the activities will include: - Stakeholders /community outreach, Sites Technical Study, Conducting necessary procurement and contracting process, Implementation works of Dignified Shelters with inclusive WASH and cooking facility (WCF), Shelter Unites handover to beneficiaries and follows up, Camps/sites Internal roads graveling, provided Drainage System, lighting Poles Installation
WASH: TAS will provide WASH services to IDPs in Al Omran Camp (targeted with dignified Shelter units), including safe drinking water, garbage removal, deportation, sewage system and waste desludging, and water quality monitoring. The activities will include Water tracking, Water quality monitoring (water trucking and water network, Construction of high-water tanks and connecting it to sub-tanks, Establishment of water networks inside Al Omran camp, and Operational support for the existing water station and water network including chlorine, and equipment maintenance, Construction of family latrines blocks with special arrangements for PWD, Installation of septic tanks and link it to the latrine’s blocks in the dignified shelter, Organic and wastewater disposal, distribution garbage bin and Garbage deportation.
FS: TAS will support access to basic food life-saving services for the most vulnerable HHs by distributing bread bundles on a daily basis to the same beneficiaries in Al Omran camp, and will be done through verifying beneficiaries, Contracting with Bakeries for providing bread for 9 months, Wheat Flour Procurement, Monitoring of Bread Production and bread distribution.
Edu: TAS will support 17 schools by providing only 260 teachers in formal and non-formal schools with incentives, as TAS is already seeking support from the same schools for the rest of the activities in another project, including running costs, teaching and learning materials, incentives, and so on.
As a result, this intervention will complement the second project submitted to SCHF to ensure inclusive coverage of the basic requirements to facilitate the education process in the targeted schools and protect children at risk.
- TAS will guarantee that the principle of Do No Harm is applied in all project activities through exit surveys. - TAS coordinated with related clusters, as well as other field actors, to reach the proper beneficiaries and avoid duplication. - Female and male project staff will be trained on gender equality and protection principles. - TAS will monitor the implementation using its monitoring system and onsite monitoring.
